intro: Echinolobium argenteum, commonly known as silver globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and rocky areas. Echinolobium argenteum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
